title: Employment trends in the Electric Vehicle (EV) industry
excerpt: India’s ambition to become a top player in the emerging electric vehicle market will lead to 5 million new direct job opportunities, according to a report...
desc: India’s ambition to become a top player in the emerging electric vehicle market will lead to 5 million new direct job opportunities, according to a report by Careernet. Between 2020 and 2022, EV jobs saw a 110% compound annual growth rate. Bengaluru, a hub for manufacturing and innovation, is expected to become a vital centre for the sector. The top jobs in FY22 were battery management systems and support roles, with engineering and R&D skills being the most sought-after.

Manufacturers and service providers will equip themselves with support roles to transition into the electric vehicle industry. Expats are also showing interest in short-term assignments in India, with pay hikes for those involved in conceptualising, designing, and building core technologies for these vehicles and infrastructure. The formalisation of the economy will also lead to higher paychecks for support roles, and policy outreach will allow their earning potential to scale up.

title: The State of LGBTQ+ Hiring in India
excerpt: As part of its commitment to fostering diverse and inclusive workplaces, Careernet Prism, an initiative of Careernet, a leading talent solutions provider in India, conducted...
desc: As part of its commitment to fostering diverse and inclusive workplaces, Careernet Prism, an initiative of Careernet, a leading talent solutions provider in India, conducted an extensive market study to examine the 'State of LGBTQ+ Hiring in India.' This study involved the participation of 105 LGBTQ+ employees and qualitative interviews with 20 D&I leaders. The findings of the study have been compiled into a comprehensive report, which sheds light on prevailing trends, challenges, and working conditions faced by LGBTQ+ employees in India, as well as the inclusion policies implemented in various workplaces.

The study highlights instances of workplace harassment, discriminatory treatment, and limited job opportunities for the LGBTQ+ community. Furthermore, the report emphasises the lack of LGBTQ+ representation in the workplace, resulting in the neglect of their concerns and grievances. While 50% of the respondents have been open about their community identity at work and feel supported by their organisations, they still face discrimination from co-workers and superiors. It is worth noting that only a small percentage, approximately 15-20%, of employees across organisations are currently sensitised to issues related to the LGBTQ+ community, indicating a need for increased awareness and understanding among co-workers.

title: Moving Towards Equality, An overview of the hiring trends in 2022
excerpt: Careernet enables employers to foster gender diversity by placing an increasing number of women candidates over the past few years. In the report “Moving Towards Equality...
desc: Careernet enables employers to foster gender diversity by placing an increasing number of women candidates over the past few years. In the report 'Moving Towards Equality – an overview of the hiring trends in 2022', we bring out insights into the Indian female workforce across industries. For the report, we studied the data of the calendar year 2022 to analyse hiring sentiments across a comprehensive range of experience levels and industries, spread over 6 cities (Tier-1) across India.

To conduct this analysis, we gathered data from a variety of sources, including internal data, and career portals of employers, and measured the hiring trends. We analysed a sample size of about 16,000 placements in the year 2022. This report focuses on the representation of women in the workforce and unfolds a comprehensive view of current and emerging women talent requirements and possible future trends.
